item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, September 1, 2024 at 2:50 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Building LLMs from the Ground Up: A 3-Hour Coding Workshop (286 points | 6 comments)
2. My first experience with Gleam Language (52 points | 15 comments)
3. Harder Drive: hard drives we didn't want, or need [video] (2022) (280 points | 47 comments)
4. WatchYourLAN: Lightweight Network IP Scanner (92 points | 8 comments)
5. Did your car witness a crime? (175 points | 382 comments)
6. LLMs struggle to explain themselves (18 points | 19 comments)
7. Making an atomic trampoline [video] (36 points | 6 comments)
8. Compilation of JavaScript to WASM, Part 2: Ahead-of-Time vs. JIT (90 points | 7 comments)
9. AirTags key to discovery of Houston's plastic recycling deception (66 points | 40 comments)
10. A brief history of barbed wire fence telephone networks (30 points | 3 comments)
11. Percona Everest: open-source automated database provisioning and management (37 points | 2 comments)
12. Astronomers puzzled by little red galaxies that seem impossibly dense (27 points | 7 comments)
13. Client-side QR code generator with SVG output (58 points | 6 comments)
14. Show HN: A retro terminal text editor for GNU/Linux coded in C (C-edit) (126 points | 30 comments)
15. Continue (YC S23) Is Hiring a Software Engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)
16. Oprah will screw up the AI story (14 points | 4 comments)
17. Neutral beam microscopy using magnetic beam spin encoding (13 points | discuss)
18. MapRoulette: the micro-tasking tool for OpenStreetMap (3 points | discuss)
19. Lucee: A light-weight dynamic CFML scripting language for the JVM (60 points | 22 comments)
20. Show HN: Typeform alternative, turns Markdown to forms (121 points | 37 comments)
21. Brazil's X ban is sending lots of people to Bluesky (110 points | 202 comments)
22. Building Bubbletea Programs (138 points | 37 comments)
23. Solving the labyrinth puzzle from the university quest using Python (3 points | discuss)
24. Boox Palma Review: A Phone-Sized E-Ink Android Device That Isn't a Phone (58 points | 48 comments)
25. Buy, Borrow, Die – Explained (325 points | 257 comments)
26. Is my vision that bad? No, it's just a bug in Apple's Calculator (556 points | 354 comments)
27. My fake job in Y2K preparedness (104 points | 69 comments)
28. The thrill of AI is fading – and Wall Street is getting clear-eyed about value (4 points | discuss)
29. The Threat to OpenAI (100 points | 101 comments)
30. Freetube is the best way to watch YouTube (65 points | 59 comments)
